Whodunit? Mafia


Reviewed by: Vi, zoraster, and xRECKONERx


”Your life is good”, you kept repeating to yourself over and over as you stare at the decapitated head of the mailman staring up at you with blank eyes. You don’t know how long you screamed when you walked out to grab the morning newspaper. All you know is that it attracted all your neighbors to see what was wrong. At that moment, as you scanned the faces of those there, born of a deep instinct, you knew the culprits to be among those gathered. At that moment, you knew it was up to you to prevent this from happening again.

Game Rules

(Stolen from various sources)

Game Mechanics

1.) Votes must be bolded and in a form similar to Vote: Playername or VOTE: Playername. If I do not see your vote, it will not count. Unvotes are nice but not required.
2.) Lynches require a majority of votes (50% of the living players +1). If a 50% + 1 majority is not reached by deadline no lynch occurs.
3.) No Lynches require only 50% of the vote to occur.
4.) If a lynch occurs, the game enters twilight and players may continue to talk in thread until it is locked and a death scene is posted. No votes/unvotes will count in twilight.
5.) Dead players cannot talk. Once you are killed/lynched do not post in thread. Not even a "bah!" post.
6.) All actions will be resolved using the Natural Action Resolution system.

Deadlines/Activity

7.) Each Day will have a two week deadline.
8.) I will consider deadline extensions on an individual basis.
9.) Treat this game as a commitment. If you are going to be V/LA please post in thread or send me a PM.
10.) Players must post every 72 hours (unless they have noted V/LA) or they will be prodded. Three total prods during the game will result in a replacement.
11.) If a player fails to pick up their prod and post in game within 24 hours they will be replaced.
12.) Each night will last approximately 48 hours, during which time all night actions must be submitted via PM.

General

13.) Have fun and be respectful to your fellow players.
14.) Do not speak about this game outside of the thread unless your role specifies that you may do so.
15.) Do not quote anything from the moderator that is said outside of this thread (including role PMs) or pretend to quote anything from the moderator. Paraphrasing is allowed but if you are questioning your paraphrase, run it by me first.
16.) If I make a mistake, please address your grievance in bold in thread or in PM. Please point out vote count errors in thread only.
17.) Do not edit posts. Do not use invisible text. Do not use small text.
18.) At least one person received the following PM:

Hello, XXXX, and welcome to Mini-Normal #XXXX!

You are a Vanilla Townie. You have no special abilities. You win when all anti-town players have been eliminated and at least one town member is still alive.

The game thread is located here. Please confirm your role by PM.

Roles distributed. Game will commence when 11 out of 13 have confirmed. 13/13 have confirmed thus far.
Game will begin momentarily.
Day 1 begins.  With 13 alive it takes 7 to lynch.  The deadline hits at September 10th, at 9am EST.

Gentlemen.

I think that a handful of RVS votes is good to start things up, but I also think that too many can reduce the impact and responses we could get from just a handful. Scum can hide well when it's too noisy, so I prefer to not add to the noise.

Also, have you played elsewhere before? That's a surprisingly valid argument against RVS from a newbie.

How many is "a handful?"

I would consider four, only one of which has generated any content, less than a handful.

Also, have you played elsewhere before? That's a surprisingly valid argument against RVS from a newbie.

I agree that four is less than a handful, but since most people don't prescribe to my method of abstaining from RVS votes (which is totally fine), the RVS count will usually get to the limit I like without mine added.

And yeah, I've been playing IRL for ~10 years or so, but I am still getting used to this online format, and figuring out what strategies translate and which don't. So I may do some things that seem odd, and may very well be wrong for online play, but I'm getting better!
Hey guys.

Hey there everyone!

I already wrote it up in an earlier post, but here is more depth. I've played Mafia in real life maybe fifteen to twenty times. I've played a couple of rounds of epic mafia before learning how stupid it was. I've played maybe one or two games of forum Mafia back when I was a kid, and they popped up in my favorite boards. To expound on my statement, at least in live mafia, there is a tendency to never lynch. It's in the hope that somehow things will be made clear with time, and often how I managed to win as scum.

I think the prevailing thought here is the longer the town talks, the more likely information will come out that can be used to find scum later (or that day even) - slips, associations, etc. There's no real benefit to lynching quickly for town aside from the possibility of losing out on correct gut reactions and interest waning.
